issue.subject: Enhancement of "ressource page" layout and feature
issue.description:
We would like tu suggest some enhancements in the "ressource page" :

* Layout

replace in the column "type" the texts by "icons" and display them before the name of the ressourc
(the idea is to have more place for the title and less text for simpler screen)

* Feature

add the ability "sort by" on column "name" by just clicking on the title of the colomn

Question : do we need to keep status "deleted" in the filter ? 



What do you think ?

journals.notes:
Thomas, I would like to have your opinion on this proposal.

Thanks.

It is possible to manage replacement of the  label type via css in your template. I think it will be more simple than associate an icon to the ressource type in EasySDI. Do you suggest that also to change the search field in catalog search?

Ordering column by clicking on the column name would be great.

Yes, the status "deleted" can be dropped.

OK for "delete" status.
OK for oreding feature.

Concerning the status with or/icon... yes it could be done through CSS.. But I am not sure it's a good idea. 
To be discussed further.

I "vote" for the CSS solution:
- it's easier to code (we don't need to add backend configurations for images or icon to ressource types)
- we just add a CSS class to the items. Why not use the alias of ressource type (maybe prefixed, to avoid collisions) 
- this solution won't impact users that wont use the feature
That's OK for me... developper's opinion is much more valuable on this kind of issue :-)

OK, so the summary of this ticket is (TODO) :

- add the ability "sort by" on column "name" by just clicking on the title of the colomn

That's all :-)

Another thing that is missing on this page :"results number".

It should be displayed above the list / below the filter (as usual I would say).

It's clearly missing.

New summary of the ticket :

- add the ability "sort by" on column "name" by just clicking on the title of the colomn
- add result number below the filter (OR in pagination maybe ? to discuss...)
- add a CSS class "resource type" to each item (based on alias of ressource type and prefixed, to avoid collisions)
- add a CSS class "type of access scope" to each item (also prefixed to avoid collisions)
